item.title: Lumera
item.description:
The Goddess of Genesis. The kindest, gentlest being who created the world and everyone in it. Revered by the Genesis Church
Responsible for The Genesis

item.title: Thomas Elric
item.description:
Head of The Elric House during the March Turmoil.
What was once the strongest and most powerful of the great noble houses was corrupted by prince Wade Xeclyde.
Thomas was Wade's right hand man during the March Turmoil. It was said that he looked like a horrific and disfigured combination of animals when he became an evil cultist, having the head of a lion, the torso of a bear and tentacles for limbs.

item.title: Felder Elric
item.description: Current Leader of The Elric House. Not much is known about him, but many say he has resorted to heretical magic to strengthen his house. Under his tenure the Elric house is regaining its splendor.

item.title: The Elric House
item.description:
Rival house of the Ascarts. They once were a prosperous house, second only to the Xeclydes themselves. However, during the march turmoil, The Elric leader at the time, Thomas, supported the heretical Prince of the Xeclydes and after the war, the heavy reparations the Elrics had to pay pushed their house to the brink of destruction, but they seemed to have rebound recently and are now a strong house again, almost on par with the Ascarts.Members Thomas Elric
Felder Elric
item.guid: Saint Mesit Theocracy/Houses/Elric House/The Elric House.md

item.title: Winston Ascart
item.description: Winston and Ro Ascart 2 great ascestors of the Ascarts. They were powerful and knowledgeable. Both Loved going out and exploring ruins, but both died the same way, by mysteriously disappearing one day. To this day its not known what happened to them.

item.title: Ro Ascart
item.description: Ro and Winston Ascart 2 great ascestors of the Ascarts. They were powerful and knowledgeable. Both Loved going out and exploring ruins, but both died the same way, by mysteriously disappearing one day. To this day its not known what happened to them.

item.title: Roel Ascart
item.description: Renowned historian of the theocracy. A big history buff who loves uncovering the truth of the past. Not as strong as his ancestors yet he has brought great prosperity to the Ascart house and land. While not as strong as his father, Roel's true prowess lies not in the sword but on the pen. Like his ancestors Ro Ascart and Winston Ascart, Roel has taken the book and become a paragon of knowledge. He has brought great prosperity to the Ascart land throught his numerous great proposals.

item.title: Carter
item.description:
Previous leader of The Ascart House. Great strength and well verse in matters of war, but terrible in everything else.
Lost her wife after the birth of his son Roel Ascart. Never remarried out of love for his wife. Truly uncommon in the noble world. Noticing the great intellect and talent of his son, he decided to entrust the whole Ascart House and its territories to Roel while he became great general and focused on war matters instead.

item.title: Nora Xeclyde
item.description: Current "Princess" of the Xeclyde.

item.title: The Xeclyde House
item.description:
Current Leaders of the theocracy. They are said to possess the blood of angels as they are descendants of the Angels that once served as the right hand of the Goddess. Righteous, Noble and Compassioned. The Xeclydes represent what a true Lumerian should be, and thorough history have showed great courage, wisdom and leadership.Notable Members Victoria Xeclyde

item.title: Saint Mesit

item.title: Monster Invasions
item.description: Recurrent invasions by monsters of which origins are unknown. It happens every few hundred years in different parts of the world. The most recent invasion happened in The Saint Mesit Theocracy where Pope, John Xeclyde played a key role in the defense.

item.title: Victoria Xeclyde
item.description:
Royal Princess, child of Ryan Xeclyde and Consort Mary.
Twin of Wade Xeclyde. She was a very beautiful and intelligent flower, and like her brother, she possessed great talents in many things.
Shortly after turning 10, it was discovered her mother, Consort Mary, was a heretic.
She was thus send off to a faraway monastery where she would die 4 years later during the Red Dead Plague.
This news greatly affected her, but with help of her magic teacher, Ponte Ascart, she managed to pick herself back up and become an even better version of herself.
She would then have to face his brother, Wade Xeclyde, during the March Turmoil after discovering he was an evil cultist.
Together with Ponte Ascart, she bravely faced the army of hell that the evil Wade raised until the Pope arrived and defeated Wade Xeclyde. She would then go on to become a great ruler, and one of the very few female monarchs the theocracy has ever had.

item.title: Wade Xeclyde
item.description:
Royal Prince, child of Ryan Xeclyde and Consort Mary.
Twin of Victoria Xeclyde. Wade was a man of great talent. From very young he showed great promise be it in studies, swordsmanship, leadership, and religion. Many thought the future of the Theocracy looked bright with him destined to be on the helm, but things would not go so smoothly.
Shortly after turning 10, it was discovered her mother, Consort Mary, was a heretic.
She was thus send off to a faraway monastery where she would die 4 years later during the Red Dead Plague.
This lead to Wade Xeclyde joining an evil cult and wanting to destroy the theocracy during the March Turmoil.
He would later on fail to kill her sister, Victoria Xeclyde, and the Pope, Ryan Xeclyde would go on to defeat him. Thus came the end of a man with a bright future who sadly fell into the clutches of evil.

item.title: Ryan Xeclyde
item.description:
Holy imminence and Pope of the Genesis Church during the March Turmoil.
Had twins in Wade Xeclyde and Victoria Xeclyde.
He fell deeply in love with Consort Mary but sadly he would go on to discover she was a heretic and banish her to a faraway monastery.
Later on, during one of his visits to The Austinian Empire, new reached him that his son, Wade Xeclyde had fallen to evil. Wade, having joined a cult and raising an army with spawns of hell, would go on to stage a revolt in the theocracy.
Rushing back, Ryan would barely make it in time to save his daughter Victoria Xeclyde and defeat his son to save the theocracy.
Having faced the Red Dead Plague, discovering his love was a heretic, knowing his wife died and then having to kill his very own son, Ryan's life was one filled with tragedy.
Luckily Victoria Xeclyde would go on to become a great monarch, letting him rest in peace during his final days, knowing the theocracy was in good hands.

item.title: Consort Mary
item.description:
Royal Consort. Mother of the royal twins Wade Xeclyde and Victoria Xeclyde. After it was discovered she was a heretic, she was send away for the rest of life to live in a monastery.
She would tragically die during the Red Dead Plague.

item.title: March Turmoil
item.description:
In the 1100s, the Theocracy's ruling family, the Xeclydes, would see the birth of a pair of twins, a son and a daughter. Both the son, Wade Xeclyde, and the daughter, Victoria Xeclyde, were extremely talented and from a very young age displayed both great power and great knowledge. 36
But, what should have been great news for the family and theocracy would take an unexpected turn when Victoria Xeclyde would discover that her little brother, Wade Xeclyde, was related to an evil cult. The son and successor of the Holy Eminence involved with an evil cult, quite ironic.
Victoria Xeclyde was careful with this knowledge, knowing how precarious her position as the second in line was and to prevent being labeled a rebel, so she decided to consult with Ponte Ascart, her teacher.
Together, they worked relentlessly to gather enough evidence to oust him to his Holy Eminence, who was away in the The Austinian Empire.
Little did they know Wade Xeclyde was already aware of their plans thus launching his revenge. On his side was The Elric House, the other great noble houses and an army of evil cultist that looked like they crawled from hell itself and The Ascart House sided with Victoria Xeclyde while the rest remained neutral. Victoria's side fought bravely against the army of hell that the now evil cultist Wade had raised, but they used cowardly and underhanded tactics and human sacrifices of innocent people to push back.
Very soon the streets of the Theocracy would be filled with corpses and blood. The casualties on both side were many, but thanks to Ponte Ascart and his magic, Victoria Xeclyde and her forces managed to hold out until his eminence arrived, who would then take down Wade Xeclyde and his hell army, thus bringing and end to the March Turmoil.

item.title: Ponte Ascart
item.description:
Great Magician of the Ascart house. Teacher of Victoria Xeclyde
Played a key role on the March Turmoil by being the only of the Great Noble house to side with Victoria Xeclyde and keeping her safe until pope Ryan Xeclyde arrived.

item.title: The Burning of the Saint
item.description:
While happening away from the theocracy, the burning of the saint remains one of the most controversial moments in the shared history between The Saint Mesit Theocracy and The Austinian Empire and one of the reasons the relationship between the two have been so strained.
Very early on the Third Epoch, in one of the territories of The Austinian Empire, the Saint Theresa once visited, with the intentions of providing help and spreading the word of the Genesis Church. At the once prosperous territory of Ecliris, the bastard noble, Reginald Mazias was in power.
As fate would have it, the great popularity of Saint Theresa and the immense paranoia of Reginald Mazias would combine into a tragic event.
During her visit, Saint Theresa would find herself imprisoned by Reginald Mazias after the latter thought that the saint was planning a coup due to her great popularity. Against every and all advice, Reginald Mazias went ahead and decided to burn the saint, accusing her of being a witch. The people would find out and tried to go to where she was bound to be burn and attempted to save the saint, which only fueled Reginald's paranoia even more, who then ordered his guards to strike down anyone who attempted to get close to and save the saint.Whether it was due to the madness of Reginald, the burning of a saint, or the death of innocent people, even the devils themselves joined.
Soon, devils would rise from the ground and wreak havoc on Ecliris.
Fire, death, blood and destruction. Ecliris had become a sight from hell itself. The territory was destroyed, its people killed, and both the saint and Reginald where killed.
After this tragic events, the relationship between The Saint Mesit Theocracy and The Austinian Empire would deteriorate greatly. The Theocracy would blame the Empire for the brutal death of the saint, while the Empire claimed no responsibility over it.
item.guid: Saint Mesit Theocracy/Events/The Burning of the Saint.md

item.title: Saints
item.description:
"Saints" Those are the names given to those who are a paragon of virtue, compassion and kindness who embrace the teachings of the Genesis ChurchThere have been many saints throughout history. Many named directly by the church, many others named by the people unofficially.
From all ages and origins, the saints have always been loved symbols of Lumera.

item.title: Red Dead Plague
item.description: Deadly plague that hit The Saint Mesit Theocracy and The Austinian Empire hundreds of years ago. It had a high mortality rate and took many lives.

item.title: Unyielding Pursuit
item.description:
Several centuries ago, there was a powerful cult that had reached the peak of its influence back then that attempted to challenge the Genesis Church.
They assassinated a member of The Xeclyde House. The result of their actions was an unyielding pursuit with utterly no regard for the cost that lasted for a whole forty years.
Over the forty years, the cult traveled across all of the human countries and even tried hiding in the depths of a remote mountain range. However, no matter where they went, they were never able to hide from the eyes of the Genesis Church. It felt like a sword was forever floating above their heads, threatening to sever their necks as soon as they tried to rest.Just like that, a group that once boasted over 10,000 cultist was utterly massacred to the final cultist over the course of forty years. Through its actions, the church gave a stern warning to all cults and rival powers:"You can run wherever you want, but you'll never be free"

item.title: The Genesis
item.description:
In the beginning, there was only the goddess Lumera, a single point of gentle light in an ocean of nothing. She opened her eyes and the darkness fled, thus that first glance became the sky. She smiled and the smile became the sun. She sighed with happiness and that sigh became the wind, the seas and the hills. From her warmth she shaped every living thing. Flowers that bloomed for her. Birds that learned to sing her name. Animals that walked out of the light to meet her. Last of all, she gathered the deepest, softest part of her own heart, molded it, and that became humans. She set them gently on the new earth. "Love one another", she said gently, "the way I love you."
Then, Lumera stepped back, her light settling over everything like a dawn that never ends, and the world began to turn.

item.title: Genesis Church
item.description: Church of the Genesis religion of the theocracy. THE religion of the world following the goddess Lumera

item.title: Second Epoch
item.description:
Previous Epoch. Most of the historical records of this time period were lost during The Cataclysm.
What little we know of this Epoch is thanks to the few records recovered, particularly in The Austinian Empire and thanks to the effort of the The Country of Scholars, Harvard to restore many of these records.

item.title: The Cataclysm
item.description:
The Cataclysm is the event that marked the end of the Second Epoch.This was a time of death and destruction as war, plague, and disasters took place and many places of the world at once. How or why this happen is unknown, often attributed to divine retribution or caused by evil cults.This event destroyed every country at the time, with the only country that managed to come back from the brink of destruction being the The Austinian Empire Every other country was lost to time, as 90% of the population of the planet lost its life during this time period. With them, the historical records were lost, making this period a dark age in history, with very little known aside from the few historical records that were salvaged, the few that remained in the Austinian Empire and the tales told by those who survived.
The survivors managed to get back on their feat and would go on to create the countries of the new world: The Country of Scholars, Harvard, The Knight Kingdom, Camelot, The Rose Merchant Confederacy, The Saint Mesit Theocracy, Roses, and The Austinian Empire

item.title: First Epoch
item.description: Virtually nothing is known of the First Epoch as most of the already few remaining records were lost together with all the records of the Second Epoch during the The Cataclysm
